com.joml.matrix

Class Matrix3f

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.joml.matrix.Matrix3f

  • public class Matrix3f
extends Object
    Matrix3f Contains the definition of a 3x3 Matrix of floats, and associated functions to transform it. The matrix is column-major to match OpenGL's interpretation, and it looks like this: m00 m10 m20 m01 m11 m21 m02 m12 m22
    Author:
    Richard Greenlees

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public void set(Matrix3f m1)
        Set the values in this matrix to the ones in m1

      • mul

        public void mul(Matrix3f right)
        Multiplies this matrix by the supplied matrix. This matrix will be the left-sided one

      • mul

        public static void mul(Matrix3f left,
       Matrix3f right,
       Matrix3f dest)
        Multiplies the left matrix by the right, and stores the results in dest. Does not modify the left or right matrices

      • mulFast

        public static void mulFast(Matrix3f left,
           Matrix3f right,
           Matrix3f dest)
        Multiplies the left matrix by the right, and stores the results in dest. Does not modify the left or right matrices. This is not alias safe so make sure dest is not the same object as the original or you WILL get incorrect results!

      • set

        public void set(float m00,
       float m01,
       float m02,
       float m10,
       float m11,
       float m12,
       float m20,
       float m21,
       float m22)
        Sets the values within this matrix to the supplied float values. The result looks like this:

        m00, m10, m20 m01, m11, m21 m02, m12, m22

      • set

        public void set(float[] m)
        Sets the values in this matrix based on the supplied float array. The result looks like this:

        0, 3, 6
        1, 4, 7
        2, 5, 8

        Only uses the first 9 values, all others are ignored

      • determinant

        public float determinant()
        Returns the determinant of this Matrix

      • invert

        public void invert()
        Inverts this matrix

      • invert

        public static void invert(Matrix3f source,
          Matrix3f dest)
        Inverts the source matrix and stores the results in dest. Does not modify the source

      • invertFast

        public static void invertFast(Matrix3f source,
              Matrix3f dest)
        Inverts the source matrix and stores the results in dest. Does not modify the source This is not alias safe so make sure dest is not the same object as the original or you WILL get incorrect results!

      • invert

        public static void invert(Matrix3f source,
          FloatBuffer dest)
        Inverts the source matrix and stores the results in dest. Does not modify the source This is not alias safe so make sure dest is not the same object as the original or you WILL get incorrect results!

      • transpose

        public void transpose()
        Transposes this matrix

      • transpose

        public static void transpose(Matrix3f original,
             Matrix3f dest)
        Transposes the supplied original matrix and stores the results in dest. The original is not modified

      • transpose

        public static void transpose(Matrix3f original,
             FloatBuffer dest)
        Transposes the supplied original matrix and stores the results in dest. The original is not modified

      • transposeFast

        public static void transposeFast(Matrix3f original,
                 Matrix3f dest)
        Transposes the supplied original matrix and stores the results in dest. The original is not modified. This is not alias safe so make sure dest is not the same object as the original or you WILL get incorrect results!
